The American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology (AAAAI) is the leading membership organization of more than 7,000 allergists/immunologists and patients’ trusted resource for allergies, asthma, and immune deficiency disorders. The American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology (AAAAI) is the leading membership organization of more than 7,000 allergists/immunologists and patients’ trusted resource for allergies, asthma, and immune deficiency disorders. This membership includes allergists/immunologists, other medical specialists, allied health, and related healthcare professionals-all with a special interest in the research and treatment of allergic and immunologic diseases.

Reasons You Need to Be a Member of the American Academy of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology

At the center of all that AAI stands for and the opportunities, it provides for the immunology community are its members. Totaling over 7,700 in 68 countries, AAI members are principal investigators, postdoctoral fellows, graduate students, administrators, and other professionals who believe in and want to further the field. They join AAAAI for career development opportunities, awards eligibility, participation in the world’s largest annual all-immunology meeting and our comprehensive and cutting-edge immunology courses, access to scientific publications, and more. They remain, long-term members because they quickly realize that AAI supports their professional lives and is a powerful voice on Capitol Hill, to NIH and other sources for federal funding, and to the entire international scientific community.

Membership Categories of the American Academy of Allergy & Immunology and Its Cost (U.S. Dollars)

Regular Membership – $260

Eligibility

  • Must possess a Ph.D. in immunology or a related discipline and have published at least one article on an immunological topic in a reputable English-language, peer-reviewed journal.

Associate Membership – $260

Eligibility

  • Possess a range of academic accomplishments and experience in the field of immunology.

 Trainee Membership

Eligibility and Cost

$85 Postdoctoral,

$75 Young Professional,

$64 Graduate Student,

$50 Undergraduate.

Must be an undergraduate student, recent college graduate (young professional), graduate student, or postdoctoral trainee engaged in a program that could lead to a career in Immunology.

Emeritus Membership

Open to Regular members who have retired due to age or disability.

Benefits of Being an American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology (AAAAI) Member

  • Career Development

It supports the career development of immunologists at every career stage through awards, grants, fellowships, annual meetings, and courses. AAAAI provides career advancement opportunities through its numerous mentoring and networking programs, such as AAAAI Awards and Grants, AAAAI Fellowships, Travel for Techniques, Training and Job Opportunities, Career Development at Annual Meetings, Grant Review for Immunologists Program (GRIP)

  • Service and Recognition

Membership provides the opportunity to: qualify as a candidate for the AAAAI elections, vote in AAAAI elections and select the AAAAI leadership of the future, serve as a symposium chair or Abstract Programming Chair for the AAAAI annual meeting, serve on AAAAI committees and as representatives of AAAAI to other organizations, serve on editorial Boards.

  • Scientific Advances

Membership offers you the opportunity to stay abreast of the latest scientific research and developments, career activities of your peers, and news important to immunology with personal subscriptions to The AAAAI Newsletter and reduced subscription fees, The Journal of Immunology (JI) and ImmunoHorizons(IH)

  • Financial Benefits

Reduced fees for abstract submission, honoring outstanding research and career achievements, providing career development through trainee salary support, travel grants, reduced fees for publishing color figures, reduced fees for author choice, and reduced registration fees for the AAAAI meetings.

  • Representation and Advocacy

Through its office of public affairs, AAAAI members have the opportunity to engage Congress and federal funding agencies that directly impact immunology research.

Functions of the American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology (AAAAI)

Foundation is dedicated to finding treatments and cures for the millions of people suffering from allergies, asthma, and other immunologic diseases by supporting education and research.
